intro: Senecio schizopetalus, commonly known as the African marguerite, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its foliage is usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Senecio schizopetalus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and resilience.
